reviews.text:
Bug Title: Swagger-UI Incorrectly Accepts 0-Byte CSV Upload with Success Indicator

Description:
When uploading a 0-byte CSV file via Swagger-UI, the UI incorrectly displays a success checkmark (✅), suggesting the file was ingested successfully.
However, an empty CSV is invalid input and should be rejected at the API level.
reviews.reason_text: States an enforceable behavior at the API level.

reviews.text: This leads to misleading feedback for users and allows for invalid ingestion attempts to go unnoticed.

Expected Behavior:
	•	The backend should validate that uploaded CSV files are larger than 0 bytes.
•	The content-type must be explicitly validated (e.g., text/csv).
•	If an uploaded file is empty or improperly formatted, the API must return a 400 Bad Request response with a clear error message.
reviews.reason_text: Prescribes API response on invalid files.

reviews.text: •	The incident should be logged in the ingest_failures log with relevant metadata (timestamp, user ID, endpoint, reason).

Acceptance Criteria:
	•	Add backend checks for file size (> 0 bytes) and correct content-type.
•	Update the API to respond with HTTP 400 on invalid CSV uploads.
reviews.reason_text: mandates API response on invalid uploads.

reviews.text: •	Create a Cypress test to simulate 0-byte upload and assert failure behavior.
reviews.reason_text: Details testing steps rather than requirement.

reviews.text: •	Ensure logs are correctly populated in ingest_failures.
reviews.reason_text: Outlines logging actions without enforceable behavior.

reviews.text:
Priority: Medium
Impact: Affects data integrity and user trust during ingestion.
reviews.reason_text: Reports impact and priority without enforceable action.
